name: Dessky Security
author: Dessky Team

sections.description:
Dessky Security is the ultralight plugin for basic Security Hardening. It is specially designed not to drain any resources from your website. Once you enable all major security measures your input is no longer required. Features include upload directory restriction, disabling of plugin/theme editor, admin username check and more.

This plugin was developed by Dessky Team.

Dessky Team does not provide support for the Dessky Security on the WordPress.org forums. In order to get support or make a suggestion from a Dessky Team you will have to Join Our Open Community and Start a Discussion.

DISCUSS WITH THE DESSKY TEAM

JOIN OUR OPEN COMMUNITY: The purpose of this open community is to have a collective place where the community can help each other, and we can get some feedback to improve Dessky Security as well. Joining the community is also a great way to connect with like-minded people and share your experience.

You can also GET THE PREMIUM SUPPORT

User Documentation: Although Dessky Security is already easy to set up, we’ve put together tutorials, guides, and some knowledge bases to help you set up and get started with it.

I have further questions, how do I contact you?

Please fill up the contact form and we would be more than happy to assist.

Credits: Dessky Security is based on the ‘Sucuri WordPress Security’ plugin developed by Daniel Cid.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin folder dessky-security to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” page in WordPress.
  3. After activating a new menu item “Dessky Security” would appear at the bottom of left menu.
  4. Go to Dessky Security -> Hardening and activate all “Must have security measures” until they are all colored in green.

That’s it, your website is secure. Enjoy!
sections.faq:
Does your plugin conflict with WordFence?

The plugin does not have conflict with WordFence.

Will this plugin impact the performance of my website?

No, it will definitely not.

Are there any issues installing your plugin with any hosts?

Not that we are aware of.
sections.changelog:
1.3

  • Various improvements.

1.2

  • Added compatibility for WordPress 4.9.
  • Even more performance improvements.
  • Various bug fixes.

1.1

  • Minor image icon change.

1.0

  • Initial release.
